summary: Gathers multiple VCF files from a scatter operation into a single VCF file

arguments.summary: read one or more arguments files and add them to the command line
arguments.name: --arguments_file

arguments.summary: Size of the cloud-only prefetch buffer (in MB; 0 to disable).
arguments.name: --cloud-prefetch-buffer

arguments.summary: If true, create a VCF index when writing a coordinate-sorted VCF file.
arguments.name: --create-output-variant-index

arguments.summary: Don't check relative ordering of contigs when doing a conventional gather
arguments.name: --disable-contig-ordering-check

arguments.summary: Choose which method should be used to gather: BLOCK gathering is faster but onlyworks when you have both bgzipped inputs and outputs, while CONVENTIONAL gather is much slower but should work on all vcf files. AUTOMATIC chooses BLOCK if possible and CONVENTIONAL otherwise.
arguments.name: --gather-type

arguments.summary: A configuration file to use with the GATK.
arguments.name: --gatk-config-file

arguments.summary: If the GCS bucket channel errors out, how many times it will attempt to re-initiate the connection
arguments.name: --gcs-max-retries

arguments.summary: Project to bill when accessing "requester pays" buckets. If unset, these buckets cannot be accessed.  User must have storage.buckets.get permission on the bucket being accessed.
arguments.name: --gcs-project-for-requester-pays

arguments.summary: Disable sanity checks to improve performance, may result in silently creating corrupted outputs data
arguments.name: --ignore-safety-checks

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: Whether to use the JdkDeflater (as opposed to IntelDeflater)
arguments.name: --use-jdk-deflater

arguments.summary: Whether to use the JdkInflater (as opposed to IntelInflater)
arguments.name: --use-jdk-inflater

arguments.summary: display the version number for this tool
arguments.name: --version

description:
This tool combines together rows of variant calls from multiple VCFs, e.g. those produced by scattering calling across genomic intervals, into a single VCF. This tool enables scattering operations, e.g. in the cloud, and is preferred for such contexts over Picard MergeVcfs or Picard GatherVCfs. The tool also runs locally.

The input files need to have the same set of samples but completely different sets of loci. These input files must be supplied in genomic order and must not have events at overlapping positions.

Input

A set of VCF files, each specified in genomic order with the -I option, or a .list text file listing the set of VCFs to be merged, one file per line.

Output

A single VCF file containing the variant call records from the multiple VCFs.

Usage examples

Specify each VCF file within the command. 
 gatk GatherVcfsCloud \
     -I cohortA_chr1.vcf.gz \
     -I cohortA_chr2.vcf.gz \
     -O cohortA_chr1chr2.vcf.gz
Specify the VCF files using the following input.list: 
     cohortA_chr1.vcf.gz
     cohortA_chr2.vcf.gz
 
 gatk GatherVcfsCloud \
     -I input.list
     -O cohortA_chr1chr2.vcf.gz
name: GatherVcfsCloud
